column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took this for two months, then went off of it.  I was feeling very depressed and crying a lot.  I was also thinking about alcohol again and wanting to drink (angry about having to stop).  I started taking it again about two weeks ago and I think I feel better.  I still need to go to AA but do have a doctor who monitors my meds.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: autman, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I can drink 10-11 beers a day, in just 3-4 hours. I have been on campral for 10 weeks and still drinking every few days. Going to ask my doc for something else since this is not working for me.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: ashleyangel, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I found out about Campral in a detox facility literature box.  I was a liter a day vodka drinker 24/7.  I immediately asked my Doctor to prescribe it for me because I knew that the detox was not enough for me because I had to leave a day early due to a family emergency.  Campral worked for me sooner than what the literature said and was a lifesaver.  I had no side affects and wished I could take it forever but there comes a time when you have to put the drug down and fight for your life without this wonderful aid.  It is a miracle drug and I recommend it to anyone wanting to quit drinking.  I also recommend AA and outpatient counseling along with the Campral because not only do you need to stop drinking, you need to admit you are an alcoholic, find out what your triggers are and resolve the issues that make you as an alcoholic relapse.You also need to learn that it is a disease and it is not your fault, but it is your fault if you do not seek help and learn how to stop drinking.  My favorite slogan in AA which I highly recommend for learning the tools is "Move a muscle, change a thought".  That was   what I had to keep in mind.  Another is, if you do have an urge, rat yourself out to someone before you drink because it will help the urge pass.  Good luck to all you who pursue this journey, it is a hard journey but well worth the effort!  Godspeed!

column1: Other
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: Early stages of taking medication, only 4 weeks in.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: chulo, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: Chippers32, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Amazing - plain and simple. For darn near 35 years, I have started drinking beer at 4-4:30 and did not stop until @ 7.  As many as I could pack in (up to 12) because for the most part I tried to hide my drinking.  Tried to quit at least 100 times and had some success years ago w/antabuse then AA only.   I started full doses of Revia and Campral and had horrible side effects (one reviewer called it like a bad acid trip).  So I stopped after 3 days.  My Dr. told me to half my doses and ever since (3 + weeks) my cravings have all but gone away.  I really can not believe it.... I have continued to drink (because.... that's what I do), but I can only get down 2-3 beers. I am in a therapy program and I am bipolar, BUT - I can see the light finally at the end of the tunnel. I feel better ALL OVER, and I foresee being alcohol free very soon. It just does not do for me what it once did.....

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: free, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I drank for 40 years when I finally decided that I was tired of feeling like I was going to die.  I checked myself in to a hospital with a rehab unit and stayed there for 7 days, without any kind of withdrawal symptons, amazingly.  On the last day, the doctor asked me if I would like to try campral; I think it was relatively new at that time.  I started taking campral and haven't had a drink in five years and don't even crave it.  All my friends and my doctor can't believe that I was able to do it!  Thank God for campral and the doctor who prescribed it!

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: hopentobesober, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started taking Campral last Friday and already know it's working. I binge drank every night for over a year. Only side effect that I have noticed, that doesn't seem to be listed is, it makes me sleepy. It's awesome at night when I take my last dose, because it helps me sleep, but during the day it's kind of annoying. Has anyone else experienced that? I think I might actually be able to kick the habit with this. :-)

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Consistent drinker - needed to stop.  Campral was suggested to me at a wholistic rehab center.  I did not take it then, but when I did not conquer the fight by myself, I asked my dr for it.  Campral, along with AA is the answer.  YOU DO NEED TO SOP DRINKING WHEN YOU START CAMPRAL.  It will help you with the cravings immediately.  if you try to drink AND take Campral at the same time, you will not get the maximum positive benefit.  I'm not sure about any side effects as I am taking other Rx, but I also take ample vitamns and supplements that also help. Take a B-complex and amino acids!

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: AOK1064, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It didn't seem to quell my desires for alcohol.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: freetobe, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been on this drug for 10 days, but it's amazing.  Zero side effects.  And although the thought crosses my mind to drink, it doesn't hook me like it used to.  Once the thought was impossible to resist and I would have an inner debate until I just finally give in.  I love the freedom this drug has given me and how much happier I am being me.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: iClean, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It worked for my alcoholism, and oxycontin habit.I havent had more than 1 drink, for over 2 years. On rare exceptions that I have been served an alcoholic drink, I just politely sip, and discard it, before done.The bonus result for me, is that I have completely quit pain pill habit of 2 years as well.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: sober1229, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went to detox for the 1st time over New Yrs weekend. I have been on Campral for 19 days. For the 1st time in many yrs. I don't crave alcohol! What a blessing! But I have tremors, aches & pains, & extreme fatigue. I feel like I'm walking through waist deep mud every day. Do these side effects get better with time?

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: Campral advocate, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a serious, level five alcoholic. Drinking all my life to the point that I cannot go an our without booze. I used to be able to function, but for the past two years I have been a stumble-bum drunk.Until, I took Campral. I started 3 months ago. I take 3 pills per day ( 150 mg). I no longer have any craving for alcohol. It is truly a miracle. I only hope it does not lose effectiveness.I have slipped twice. Once at a party, once when alone in a different city. But I would classify those instances as pure selfishness. I did not crave alcohol, I merely missed the habit of "relaxing" with a drink.  That is mental, not chemical, and I believe I can avoid, or minimize, those instances.Campral is a miracle drug that every alcoholic should take. It absolutely works!I had no side effects ( no gas, bowel problems, aches, pains or ear-ringing.) However, I would not quit the drug even if I had them.Further, do not miss a pill-taking! Even one missed dose brings back the craving big-time. I also take an extra pill before attending parties where I know alcohol will be served,

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: cash, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have already sumitted a full review. As an after thought and reading a review that a side affect was ringing in the ear, I thought I should write again. I had ringing in the ear from using Lasix a diuretic in the hospital. This may sound like an oxymoron, but since useing Campral my ringing went away. It's true, don't know why and don't care.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Zero side effects.  It's very subtle.  If you drink over it, it will stop working and you will crave Al -- but a five-day relapse is better than a 15-year relapse.  It quiets the hamster cage.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: Nancy Dunn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is a miracle drug. Of course, you have to want to stop drinking, somewhat, but it does take away the cravings. I took it for 3 weeks while still drinking, and it did not help, but then I stopped drinking, and at around day 5 to 7 I realized my cravings were gone!! It repairs your brain, also, so you can "think through the drink." I cannot say enough good things about this. Only bad side effects are some loose stools and gas, but I just adjust when I take the three doses. It is better than getting drunk again!! Sober 46 days.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: (Patient)
column9: can not tell a difference. want other input

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: cas, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was a very heavy drinker, almost nightly (sometimes daily) for 25 years. I started on this drug but didn't stop drinking right away. I gradually shifted from hard liquor, to wine, to wine spritzers that became mostly club soda after a while. Within a year, I discovered that I was no longer ABLE to get intoxicated. More than two drinks puts me right to sleep. I now take one campral a day as a maintanance dose, and drink no more than 2-3 beers per WEEK. I know you're supposed to stop drinking when using this drug, and not everyone would be willing to wait for the gradual full effect I experienced the way I did it. Talk to your doctor and do what works for YOU. But I know I never would have been able to become a "normal" drinker again without this pill. I'm proof you can indeed unpickle a pickle. It's really a miracle.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol

column9: This drug has been very effective in controlling the urge to drink.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol

column9: Very good pill.  I love it.  I am without drinks now and typing.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: barneywsp, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My name is ____ and I'm an alcoholic. Campral will get you out of the hole, but AA will keep you out. We suffer from a disease of body, mind, and spirit. Campral worked during my "white-knuckle" days of recovery to ease my mental obsession with alcohol. Once the physical craving was gone (about 5 days after last drink) I believe this drug calmed obsession, moodswing and discontent. I still take Cymbalta, but only used Campral for 30 days. By turning my will over to God, asking Him to remove my obsession, WORKING the 12 steps of AA, and getting a sponsor, I have achieved the longest period of sobriety ever. Whatever works for you is wonderful. I HATE this damn disease and hope everyone can find serenity. Campral and most importantly, Alcoholics Anonymous has worked for me.

column9: Drank for years, every night and all day on weekends.  I had esophageal verices and almost died due to blood lose.  My hemoglobin count was 4.9 at the ER and received 5 units of blood transfusion.  After that I had to quit drinking, used Campral for 6 months and have not had a drink since, worked well for me and my family is glad I'll survive and live a normal life w/o Alcohol.

Definately will bring this info to my Doc. I also wanna THANK all who participate in these forums!

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug is great! Drank for years, night's and all weekend. Did 4 days of detox and started Campral. 2 tablets 3 times a day. No cravings, no desire to drink. Changed my habits, got my life back. Started to decrease my dose 3 weeks ago and now I am off. Still no desire, You have to want to stop drinking. The only side effect while on it was sore joints, around the evening time and early in the morning. I would highly recommend this to someone who wants to stop drinking, not just because they were put on it. It takes will power, the drug will help, not do miracles. I also took paxel before and after, with no side effects. I still have joint pain, hoping it will go away as the drug disapates out of my system. The joint pain was well worth the out come. Highly recomended.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: snowchik1967, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking campral 333 3x a day for a month and have been suffering severe side effects; violent diarrhea, extreme and powerful flatulence, stomach cramps so intense that my doctor thought I might have colitis, nose bleeds, blurred vision, fatigue, joint pain, headaches, increased anxiety, the list goes on!  I have not felt any benefits from this drug.  I do attend my AA meetings EVERY DAY, sometimes more than one a day. This helps me tremendously!  The "counseling" there is free and it's with people who have "experience" with this disease and how to recover from it.  I strongly recommend throwing this medicine in the trash and getting to the closest AA meeting as soon as possible!  There is hope for you...without a bunch of drugs! I mean, haven't we been polluting our bodies long enough with drugs and alcohol?  My best wishes to all of you...Blessings!

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol

column9: I have been sober for approx.45 days now..THANK YOU to Campral and AA, and Treatment. I did stop taking it 3 times a day for a week, and fell into a deep depression...went back on the way it was to be taken, and I feel fantastic.  NO more craving after drinking 18-24 beers a night!  I am so grateful for this medication!

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: finnious5478 on utube, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 31 yr old male, and a heavy drinker. While I have drank for over a decade my drinking lead to a dependency that this prescription will not help. It WILL help with cravings and I guess with urges to drink. What it WILL NOT do: help with sleeplessness, anxiety, mood swings(may even INCREASE them), it is bothersome to take 6-8 pills a day, the dosage oddly is "666"mg, hence it will not substitute for any medication to relieve the insanity you will feel ...but there is hope."A.A." on line forum at finnious5478 on utube and/or start your own. it will help with the long night... specially not that we have more time to think about not drinking.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: Jerry, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The directions for this drug say that one should be alcohol free befor taking this drug but does not say for how long. I'm a 25 year drinker who has had 3 to 4 Scotches per night for years, More on week ends.  Drinking to this point has not had a negative effect on my life. I just no that I must quit because it can't be good to drink that much!!! I started Campral on Wed. and Thursday because I work 12 hour days and figured that by the time Friday night rolled around that I have 9 doses in me. It has been over a week now and I havn't had one drop. Sunday was diffacult for me as I'm off the hole day and thaught about drinking often. This drug has helped me a lot. The only side effect was some dizzyness the first couple of days.  I'm also taking prozak and if anything they mix well together!! Hope that this rating halps someone!!!

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 22 year old male, suffering from alcoholism for 6 years. been through detox 5 times, rehab twice. have to say this drug has helped me the most out of any of the other medications i have been on. the only reason why it didnt work, was because i stopped taking it. i suggest this drug to anyone who is in or is considering treatment for alcoholism. the first week i started back on * about 2 weeks ago* no cravings, no urges to drink, the thought of course came around occasionally, but the temptation and frustration of wanting to drink wasnt there, which felt amazing. the side affects i've experienced were some discomfort in stool, but thats it. fantastic drug. even if i was told it was a placebo, i'd still take it =) its worked that well for me. and i will still continue to stay on this medication.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: soberati, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking the full dose of Campral 3 weeks ago. It definitely reduced cravings, but I still slipped a few times mostly because I missed the lifestyle not alcohol itself.After the first full week I became nauseous and vomited a few times plus diarrhea and related GI symptoms. The doc cut the dose in half and that eliminated most of the symptoms except watery stools. I began to crave a normal BM in the second week and stopped it entirely intending to go back on once my stomach cleared up. The cravings came back right away and I slipped. I do go to meetings and outpatient rehab. Had a really bad problem with getting drunk. Went back on it before having a real satisfying solid BM and within the first dose noticed a reduction in cravings. Haven't drank since. I wish there was an alternative that didn't give me these side effects or a dietary way of counteracting them, but until I find one or the other its worth it to be so utterly relieved of cravings. Not everyone experiences side effects so don't be alarmed by my experience if you are reading this in order to decide if you want to try it.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol

column9: Completely took the craving for alcohol away feel good mentally but physically Im having alot of joint pain. Makes me pee alot. Have been up in night 3-4 times. Been on it about 45 days still no cravings. Want to know what happens when someone goes off it and how do you come off it

column2: BigLar1947, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The only side effect I have noticed is an increase of ringing in my ears. Im not sure but I think this drug helps best with the physical side effects of alcoholism. My addiction is more the mental and emotional craving for mental numbness. I have used it to self medicate my depression for years.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: ex-drinker, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: at first i thought i could still drink some and stop while starting campral.........wrong idea.after getting into a volunatary intensive out-patient i developed a true understanding of my habit and the causes. once i really understood this and truly decided i wanted sobriety the medication worked and i have zero hard cravings. occassionally i do think about the old times but i "play the tape" and the outcome is not a good one so i do not drink. i really do not miss alcohol and neither do my wife or kids. this medicine is truly a blessing when used in conjunction with a complete program.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have been on Campral for about 3 weeks, and I can finally look at a liquor store without needing or wanting to drink. I used to drink almost every day, now I don't even think about drinking!

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: thebearswoman, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My brother went back to drinking a week after leaving a half way house. He had 90 days in, this did not work.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: sweetiepie4301@yahoo.com, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: Lucky, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Side effects for me are constant ringing in the ears, and anemia.  But it worked great.  I drank constantly for 16 years, now I haven't had a drop for 3 weeks.  That's amazing.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Campral has worked very well in eliminating the cravings of alcohol. This will be a very good tool for those that also use A.A. to abstain from alcohol. I do have joint pain as a side effect, but thats better than jail, court, divorce, ect.

column1: Habit of Drinking Too Much Alcohol
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I find it very effective in reducing cravings. If I even TRY to fantisize my old thoughts, there is no interest any longer. Somewhat difficult for me to remember to take it at the same time every day.
